text: It is a stylish old apartment. There are half unpacked bo moved in. The phone rings.
(into the phone) Hello.

We see Steven's best friend RICK standing in the middle o looking, cynical local news cameraman. In the background, set. ON THE TV - An anchorman sits at his desk fixing his hair on the screen says "Sam Sweet Trial Update."
How's the move going?
Steven unpacks as they speak. The phone call intercuts be
Horrible. The cable guy is missing in action. Apparently he's going to be here sometime between eight AM and my death.
You haven't called Robin have you? Please tell me you didn't call her.
(sarcastically) No, I'm giving her space. (beat) I can't believe she's doing this.
You never should have asked her to marry you. You're the mad smotherer.
All she had to do was say no. She didn't have to kick me out. I feel like Felix Unger.
You forced her to evaluate the relationship. If you didn't propose she would never have realized how unhappy she was.
I don't want to talk about it. So what time are you going to come by?
I can't. I'm working double shifts the rest of the week.
It's my first night here. Don't do this to me.
The other camera guy pulled out his back. Besides, I spent the last two weeks with you on my couch. Isn't that enough?
Fine, fine.
One piece of advice. Slip the cable guy fifty bucks, he'll give you all the movie channels for free. Even the dirty ones.
I couldn't. I'm not good at that stuff. What if he says no? I'll feel like an idiot.
None of them say no, believe me. I'll talk to you later. Steven hangs up, and waits.
Steven continues unpacking. He is very neat. He opens a b ex-girlfriend. He looks at one sadly, considering whether back in the box.
Establishing shot of a renovated apartment building built pulls into a gated side garage.
Movers deliver a small breakfast table and chairs. Steven CLOSE UP OF CLOCK - 3:52 P.M.
Steven puts a few feet of tin foil on his antenna to help nothing. He pulls it off frustrated.
Many of the boxes are gone. Steven lies on the couch, sta to fill his day without cable.
Where the hell is he?
Steven paces back and forth across the room. He stares at CLOSE UP OF CLOCK - 5:12 P.M.
Steven slowly eats a sandwich in his empty kitchen. He lo picks up the phone and dials. A machine picks up.
Hi, this is Robin. Leave a message. If you are trying to reach Steven he can now be reached at 555-3837. Steven hangs up.
Steven does sit ups. He looks at the clock. CLOSE UP OF THE CLOCK - 6:48 P.M.
(to himself) Forget it. Idiots. He gets up, and walks into the bathroom.
Steven gets undressed. He turns on the shower, adjusts th tension by letting the hot water engulf him. He takes som
(annoyed) Oh great.
Steven jumps out of the shower, soaking wet, throws on a
Don't leave! I'm here! I'm here!
Steven runs to the door.
Hello! Cable Guy! Steven reaches the door, and looks through the peep-hole.
The CABLE GUY is walking away.
Steven opens the door and yells to the Cable Guy. (Revised 11/14/95 - Pink)
Hey, wait! The Cable Guy turns back.

Well, look who decided to show up. I was just gonna go collect my retirement pension. The Cable Guy wears a clean white jump suit, and is extre speaks with a slight lisp. This lisp gives him a child-li
You were supposed to be here four hours ago.
Was I? So I'm the tardy one. Good to know.
Yes. I had to go to the Bed 'n Bath place, but now it's closed.

(turns to leave) Maybe I shouldn't have come at all  jerk off! (turns back smiling) I'm just joking. Let's do this. (looks around) Oh, the old McNair place. I never thought they'd get the floors clean after what happened here.
What happened?
(long beat) They had a lot of cats. They walk into Steven's living room.
Hey, this could be a cool pad. Here is a comment card. He pulls out a card, and hands it to Steven without turni
Please mail it in when I am done.
These go to your boss?

No, they go to me. I'm a perfectioniss... perfectioniss... (he strains to lose his lisp) perfectioniss...t. Now let's take a look at what we're dealing with. The Cable Guy walks around the room with his hands out, s
Come on baby. Come on baby. Talk to me baby. Tell me where you like it. That's it baby. He zones in on one wall. He fells the wall in a sensuous
Here's your sweet spot. He pulls out his drill, and begins drilling.
So your lady kicked you out.
What?
In preparing your service I noticed you were previously wired across town at 1268 and a half Chestnut. Last week the billing was transferred to one Robin Harris. Smells like heartbreak to me.
I really don't want to talk about it with you. Could you please just install my cable? I'm going to get dressed.
No sweat. Steven walks away, into the hallway. A moment later the C
Hey, I'm going to go to the hallway so I can access the floorboards. Don't be spooked if you hear someone crawling underneath you.
Okay, whatever. Steven walks toward his bedroom.
Put on your bathing suit 'cause you'll be channel surfing in no time. The Cable Guy pulls the trigger on his drill twice to pun
RIKKI KLIEMAN from COURT TV broadcasts from their studio.

(to camera) So ends day fifty-four of the trial of former child star Sam Sweet who has been accused of shooting his twin brother, Stan, in cold blood. The twins were stars of the hit sitcom "Double Trouble" which aired from nineteen seventy-seven till nineteen eighty-four. A video package rolls in - We see several photographs of various ages. Included is the cast photo of "Double Troub old Stan and Sam and Conrad Janis as their single dad. We see a brief clip from "Double Trouble," starring the t Sam Sweet being taken out of a police car in handcuffs.

(to camera) Life wasn't so sweet after the cancellation of their program. Hollywood chewed them up and spit them out. A frustrated Sam turned to petty larceny, while his more impressionable brother, Stan, fell in with a fringe cult called "The Brotherhood of Friends." Reduced to tabloid fodder a fury was growing inside of Sam. A burning need to be recognized as an individual, not a person famous for having an identical twin. A need that took the form of four shotgun blasts on the night of November fourteenth. And so today his attorneys continue the unusual defense of "Twin Envy."
Steven re-enters the room. The Cable Guy is watching tele
How's it going? The Cable Guy holds up one finger as if to say "quiet." H

Guilty, guilty, guilt-freakin-tee. I hope they fry this bastard. Steven sees that the Cable Guy has completely redecorated room impractical for anything other than watching televis blocking the entrance into the living room. All furniture impossible.
(looks around) What happened?
(jumps to his feet) The arrangement of your major appliances and your furniture was causing some noisy pics and hum bars in your reception. I moved a few things. Cleared it right up. Is that cool?
(non-confrontational) I... guess so.
You programmed? (off of Steven's look) Then let me slave your remotes. He picks up Steven's remotes, punches in a complicated se each other. As he holds them together he makes a face as
Ooh, maybe we should leave these two alone.
So after this I'll only need one remote for everything?

You know you're pretty good at this. You could be a cable guy yourself. (he finishes) Now let me check your levels. With amazing alacrity he adjusts color setting, sound con clicks through the channels. A music video, documentary o kids, Barney, court TV. The Cable Guy watches emotionless
All right. That about does it. I just have some paperwork for you to fill out. Sign here. Steven does.
That gave me power of attorney over you. (beat) Joking. Steven laughs. The Cable Guy joins him, but then continue long. As the laugh ends it quickly turns into an awkward to leave.
I'm about finished here. (beat) Okay. I feel good about this. Cable Guy walks to the door.
One thing.
(turns back immediately) Yeah!
I... uh... I have this friend and he said he gave his cable guy fifty bucks and he got free movie channels. Have you ever heard of anything like that?
(deadly serious) You mean illegal cable?
Uh... yes.
Who told you that? I want his name.
Forget it.
You're offering me a bribe? What you have just done is illegal, and in this state if convicted, you could be fined five-thousand dollars or spend six months in a correctional facility.
Please... that was dumb. I was just making conversation
(laughs) I'm just jerking your chain. Wake up little snoozy. I'll juice you up. All it is is a push of a button. He puts his arm around Steven and walks him toward the fr
Oh, great. How much?
Don't worry about it. I couldn't charge you. Your girl just booted you. Consider it one guy doing another guy a solid.
That is so nice.

Hey, you're a 'nice' guy. You'd be surprised how many customers treat you like shit, like I'm a god damn plumber or something. (hands him a card) Here is my personal beeper number. It's just for my preferred customers. Never call the company, they'll just put you on hold.
Thanks. Really. (holds up comment card - jokes) You're gonna get some good marks here.
Maybe some day I'll take you out to the satellite and show you how all this stuff works. It's really incredible.
Sure. We should do that one day.
How 'bout tomorrow?
Tomorrow? Tomorrow's not good.
What are you going to do, sit home and stew about your ex?
No.
(insulted) Oh, okay. I guess I crossed the line. Sorry.
(guilty) You didn't cross the line.
No? Cool. I'll pick you up at six-thirty. On the flip side. The Cable Guy leaves before Steven can reconsider. Steven that. (End Revision - Pink)
Steven is in the middle of a presentation to his co-worke impressed. Steven pulls a sheet off of an architect's model of a con

...There are twenty-four classrooms; each can be converted into a 1400 square foot home. The facility has two tennis courts, an Olympic size pool and full gym, with a stage if the residents decide they want to perform "Oklahoma." Everyone laughs. Steven is very good at his job.

The kitsch appeal of living in an old schoolhouse should be very attractive to young, upwardly mobile home buyers. And most important, the structure is available in foreclosure. If we put down a cash bid, we're going to steal this thing. There is a pause, then everyone applauds. Mr. Daniels wal around him. They speak as the meeting breaks up.
Great work Steve-o. So you're feeling good?
Yeah.
Did I hear something about you having some troubles at home?
Robin and I have been having a difficult time. I moved out, but I really think it's only temporary.
Gotcha. I love this project, but it's a big mother. Know what I mean? If it fails, corporate's going to have my ass. I've got confidence in you, but you hear where I'm coming from, bro?
Absolutely. Now I've got more time than ever. It's a good thing. (laughs) I know I can pull this thing off.
(playfully) Then what are you doing talking to me? You've got a lot of work to do. Get to it!
Thank you. I will. Hal goes down the stairs to his office. Steven watches hi JOAN.
I'll be right back.
Steven walks through the halls looking for Robin's office

ROBIN HARRIS, an attractive woman in her late twenties, s Her office is fairly nice, but she is definitely not at t papers spread all over her desk. On her walls are picture written. Steven peeks his head in her door.
Hello. Robin's face drops.
Steven, what are you doing here?
I was just in the area. Thought I'd pop by. How's work? How'd the big teen crush article come out? (Revised 11/13/95 - Blue)
They liked it. (beat) I thought we agreed we weren't going to see each other for a month.
I know, it's just Daniels accepted my proposal to renovate the old schoolhouse.
That's wonderful, congratulations.
I know I'm breaking the rules, but come have dinner with me tonight to celebrate.
I don't think we should.
Come on, this is the biggest day of my career.
Don't put me in this position.
What position? I want to share this with you.
(feeling pressured) I love you, but I need to take some time on my own to see how I feel. You agreed to this. I mean... this is exactly why we broke up, because you never listen to me.
What? Now we're broken up? What happened to 'trial separation?'
I can't get into this now. If you haven't noticed, I'm at work.
Sorry to disturb you. He turns to leave. (Revised 11/14/95 - Pink)
(sincerely) Steven. Congratulations. I know how much this means to you. You deserve it.
Thanks. He leaves.
Steven is watching television. He looks lonely and depres stopping for more than a second. He hears a horn honking outside.
Steven!!!! Stev-ey!!!! Let's go!!!! ON THE TV - A commercial for Medieval Times Restaurant. Steven walks over to the window and sees The Cable Guy st his window honking the horn.
Steven!!!! (waves) Hey buddy!!! Come on down!!! Steven waves and then steps back from the window. He does television. ON THE TV - The local news.
Coming up next a special report, "Loneliness, America's Silent Killer." Steven looks back out the window and sees the Cable Guy s down.
(begins walking to the door) What the hell.
Steven walks from his apartment to the customized van. On Cable Company - Get Wired Today."
How's it going?
Howdy partner. Climb aboard. Steven gets in.
The van drives onto the main boulevard.
Thanks for coming out. You know most people think cable is just a simple co-ax that comes out of the wall. They never take the time to understand how it works.
Where exactly are we goin?
We're going to take a ride on the information superhighway.
Birds eye P.O.V., shot follows the Cable Guy's van as it

...It all started in Lansford, Pennsylvania where Panther Valley Television, with the assistance of Jerrod Electronics, created the first cable television system. The van drives up into the hills, finally revealing a hug overlooking the entire city.
I went to Lansford once. It's the Cable Guy's Mecca. It was very emotional.
Steven and the Cable Guy get out of the van, and walk dow
I come here to think sometimes. To clear my head. They turn a corner and the satellite dish is right in fro one-hundred and fifty foot antenna. Next to that is a sma controls are located.
There she is. Right now she's sending entertainment and information to millions of satisfied citizens.
That's pretty impressive.
See, I knew the moment I met you that you would appreciate this. The Cable Guy runs to the dish. A few seconds later he ap

(with wonder) The future is now. Soon every American home will integrate their television, phone, and computer. You'll be able to visit the Louvre on one channel, and watch female mud wrestling on another. You can do your shopping at home, or play Mortal Kombat with a friend in Vietnam. There's no end to the possibilities. (waves to Steven) Come on up! What are you waiting for?!
The Cable Guy and Steven are lying in the middle of the d
Sometimes I'll sit here and imagine that there are billions of bits of information surging through me.
I've watched a lot of TV in my life. I guess I've always taken it for granted.
When I was a kid my mom worked nights. Never met dad. But the old TV was always there for me.
I know what you mean. My dad was there, but he might as well have been gone. My mom is a stewardess. She was always out of town.
(moved) That's tough. You must have a lot of abandonment issues. Reality isn't "Father Knows Best," it's a kick in the face on Saturday night. But what doesn't kill us makes us stronger, right?
(tentative) You know my brother's a speech therapist. The Cable Guy sits up. He looks angry.
So? There is a long silence. Steven doesn't know how to react
Never mind. The Cable Guy sits back down and pretends Steven never me
(beat) So, you're pretty love struck about your lady, huh?
I miss her. I asked her to marry me, and she asked me to move out.
I hate that.
She said she felt pressured. Can you believe that?

Women are a labyrinth. Can I be frank? I don't think you listen to her. I think you try to tell her what she wants to hear. She wants you to thirst for knowledge about who she is. All the complicated splendor that is woman. When your love is truly giving, it will come back to you ten-fold.
You're right. That is remarkably insightful.
Yeah, it was Jerry Springer's final thought on Friday's show.
The van pulls up in front of Steven's apartment building.
You know what? Women are suckers for "Sleepless in Seattle." It's on HBO this month. That's your bait right there.
Robin loves that movie.

They all do. Next time you talk to her tell her you're cooking yourself dinner, and watching it by yourself. Sound like you're happier than a pig in shit. She'll come running. Betcha. Then just play it cool.
Maybe I will. Steven gets out of the car.
Thanks a lot. I'm embarrassed to say this, but I don't know your name. What is it?
(touched) You really want to know my name? You do? Really? It's Ernie Douglas. But my friends call me Chip.
I'll see ya' Chip. Before he can exit the van, the Cable Guy is staring him

Let's just remember right now. You know some people walk through their entire lives and never find a true friend. (long pause) I guess we're the lucky ones. (End Revised - Pink) STEVEN'S P.O.V. - The Cable Guy is in slow motion. He bli
Uh... good-bye.
Later buddy. I'll catch ya' on the flip side. Steven exits the van feeling a little uncomfortable.
Steven and Robin are talking. Robin does not look happy t

I don't listen to you. I pretend to understand but I'm really just saying what I think you want to hear. So from now on I'm going to try my best to listen more because I do love you and am interested in learning about every detail about the complicated splendor that is you. Robin looks at him, somewhat shocked.
Oh.
I want us to get back together, but I can see why taking this time might be good for us. So, I'm not mad. After a long beat, Robin smiles.
Sometimes time apart is healthy.
You're right. Well, that's what I came here to say. Look, I've got to get back to the office. He starts getting up.
So, are you doing anything tomorrow?
I'm just going to cook myself dinner and watch a movie. "Sleepless in Seattle" is on cable.
Really?
If you're around you should drop by and check out the new apartment.
Okay, maybe I will. He exits the room. As he does we see a television broadca ON MTV - Sam Sweet sits behind the defendant's table. TAB update.

Today in the Sam Sweet case the prosecution played the 911 call that Sam Sweet made the night he murdered his brother. Keep in mind, he confessed one month later. The courtroom listens to a 911 phone call. The transcript

head_text.subj: SAM SWEET V ON THE TAPE

text: (crying and babbling) Hello, please send help. My twin brother has been shot.
Slow down sir. What happened?

Oh my god, they shot him with a shot gun four times. I mean I think it was a shotgun. Who would do such a thing?! I think it was an Asian gang or something. They were speaking some other language. Sam leans over and whispers something in his lawyer's ear
Hmm. Who indeed? Coming up next, a rare interview with Michael Jackson's zoo- keeper.
Steven is playing a pick-up, full court basketball game w but friendly game. Steven is on skins, Rick is on shirts.
Here, here, here. A player passes to Steven. Rick is covering him. Steven d
(to himself) Shit! My fault! My fault!

Not your fault. I'm in the zone. There is no stopping me today. Play begins again. A player named JEFF takes the ball out catches the ball, then drives to the basket. When he does ball rolls out of bounds into a dark corner of the gym. W hits a man's sneaker. A pair of hands pick up the ball. T Cable Guy. He is holding another ball. He starts dribblin
Hey, you guys play here, too? Cool. I was just in the neighborhood. Thought I'd run the court for a couple of innings.
(gestures to injured player) Great. We need another man.
This is... Chip Douglas... my cable guy. Rick smiles in recognition.
We met about a week ago during a routine installation, but I feel like I've known him my whole life. Steven can't believe this is happening.
Oh really. That's sweet. All right Chip Douglas, you're on shirts. Let's play.
No, I want to be on Steven's team. I'm skins. The Cable Guy quickly takes off his shirt. Steven looks s is rippled with muscles. The dichotomy between his nerdy scary.
I don't care, I'll be shirts. Let's just play.
Wait a sec'. I've got to warm up. The Cable Guy starts running wind sprints across the cour stares at him until he finishes.
Let's get it on!
Are you any good?

Feed me under the boards and you'll find out. Play begins. The shirts inbound to Jeff. The Cable Guy is humanly possible. He keeps his hands near Jeff's face, wh He couldn't be more annoying. Jeff passes to Rick who dri which goes in. Rick and Jeff slap hands.
(doing the traveling hand signal) Traveling! That's traveling!
Yeah, whatever you say Chip. Everyone runs down the court, ignoring him.
All right, so we're playing that type of game. Prison rules. I get it. Steven takes the ball out. The cable Guy runs around the crosses all over the court.
Feed me the rock! Feed me the rock! I'm open! Steven passes to the Cable Guy, who drives to the basket, process. The ball goes in.
(does the foul hand signal) And one! That's definitely a foul! (to Jeff) You want to mug me, my wallet is in my other pants.
(to Cable Guy) What are you doing?

Don't play from fear Steven. We can take these guys. MUSIC UP - SLOW MOTION - STEVEN'S P.O.V. a. The shirts put a shot which doesn't go in. The Cable G down. b. The Cable Guy drives to the basket in slow motion viol Rick. c. Rick drives to the basket. On his way he fakes out Ste The Cable guy helps Steven up. As the Cable Guy walks acr with Rick. d. The cable Guy passes the ball to Steven, then sets a n hard.
Take it to the hole! Steven is so un-nerved by the Cable Guy's behavior that h his own rebound. When he puts up a second shot, Rick gent ground. The ball does not go in.
Hey, are you okay? He pulls Steven up.
Yeah. I'm fine.

Let's switch. I'll cover Rick. The cable Guy gets in Rick's face and gives him a death s Steven takes out the ball. He passes to a teammate who pa the basket, then literally steps on Rick's back and leaps
(enraged) What the hell was that? That's it. I've had enough. Everyone begins to exit the court.
Thanks for bringing your "friend". The Cable Guy runs up to Rick.
Good game. (slaps Rick on the butt) You were tough out there. Your play brought me up to a higher level. I mean that.
(dismissive) Yeah. He shakes his head and exits with the rest of the players
What are you doing?
It was payback time. I was protecting you. (Revised 11/14/95 - Pink)
You ruined the game.
I don't appreciate your tone Steven. That's not the way friends speak to each other.
What are you talking about? I don't even know you!
Well let's fix that. Let me buy you a Heineken?
No, I'm going home. Steven turns to leave.

Well, uh, I guess we'll talk later. I've got to go shower up and do some stuff. I'll call you if I get a chance. Or you call me... or something. The Cable guy puts his hand up for Steven to high five. S cable guy extends his palm out low by his knee.
And down low. Steven stares at it for a beat. The cable Guy waits. He'l gives him a low five just so he can leave.
(pulls his hand away so Steven misses it) Too slow. Have a good one.
(as he walks away) Yeah, have a good one.
Steven runs in with a small bag of groceries. He is dress wine. He opens the oven, and checks on dinner. It is almo machine as he prepares the meal. He begins chopping an on (Revised 11/13/95 - Blue)
You have eleven messages.
(ON THE MACHINE)
Steven, it's mom. Give me a call. I'm still your mother.
(ON THE MACHINE)
I'm getting on. Steven call your mother.
(ON THE MACHINE)

Hey Steven. Just checking in. Give me a ring. I'm at 555-4329. (beep) What's up Steven? I'm at a pay phone. If you're there pick up. Pick up. Pick up. Okay, I'll be home later. I'll talk to you then. Steven stops chopping.
(ON THE MACHINE)

(beep) Okay I'm home now. Give me a buzz when you get in. I'll be here pretty much all night. Bye. (beep tone) Hey Steven. Quick question, give me a call when you get a chance. (beep tone) I was just taking a whiz, thought you might have called. Okay later. (beep tone) Sorry, I had call waiting, didn't get to it, thought it might have been you. All right, bye. Steven is beginning to get a little wigged out by this. H rest of the calls.

(fast forwards) ...We're having ourselves quite a little game of phone tag here. You're it! (fast forwards) ...I was just blow drying my hair and I thought I heard the phone ringing. (fast forwards) ...you're a tough man to reach. (fast forwards) I guess you're too busy to call your friends. (Revision Ends - Blue) Steven fast forwards the machine. All he hears is sighing
(ON THE MACHINE)
(long beat - then quiet and distant) Shit. The doorbell rings. Steven takes a deep breath then opens casually, but looks beautiful.
Hey, good to see you. There is an awkward moment where Steven intentionally doe
Come on in. What do you think of the place? She looks at the odd placement of furniture.
You made some interesting choices laying out the room.
(embarrassed) That's actually where the movers put the furniture. I'm gonna change it, very  soon.
No, I like it.
The food is all eaten. Steven and Robin are sitting on th
So how's work?
Work's good.
How's Hal?
Don't get me started. That guy has no vision. It's like working for Mr. MaGoo. He's just worthless.
It's just great that you're getting to do it. It's a real step up.
I know. Now if only someone at corporate smartened up enough to dump Hal, then I could really get some stuff done.
It's nice to see you doing so well.

Well, it's nice just to see you. (looks at his watch) Hey, it should be starting. They sit on the couch. Robin moves to sit in closer to St screen is filled with white noise. The sound is loud stat signal. Then fumbles with the remote control as he attemp
Damn cable is out. Son of a bitch.
It's alright. We can watch it another night.
No, no. We really should see it now. Now's a good time. He plays with the remote, hoping it will magically come b
Wait, wait. I know what to do. He walks over to the phone, then pulls the Cable Guy's be it, then presses the number in.
The Cable Guy's a friend of mine. I'll just page him. We'll have this fixed in no time. (Revised 11/14/95 - Pink) Steven dials the Cable Guy's beeper number into the phone
Steven walks to the door and opens it. Standing there is disturbed, different than we've ever seen him before. Ste
That was... fast.
Is there a problem with your service?
Yeah... my cable went out. Steven pushes him out into the hall.
Really? The Cable Guy holds up a cut cable cord.
So you called me. Interesting how you call when you need something. Is that how you treat people?
I've been really busy. You've got to get my cable going, Robin is here. This is really important. He peeks in to get a look at Robin. They make momentary e out.
But calling me back isn't?
I'm sorry. Please, you've got to help me.
Why should I help you? I gave you free cable. What have you ever done for me?
Anything you want. Name it  quickly.
Tomorrow night, we hang out.
Fine, whatever you want.
God bless you. You're too good to me. The Cable Guy walks over to a fuse type box, turns one kn
(loud-normally) All set.
So what's with the cut cord?

(nonchalantly) That's for effect. See ya' tomorrow Steven. (conspiratorially) She's pretty. And don't kiss her. Don't even touch her. Fight the urge at all costs. It will pay off later with... He makes a motion which implies sex.
Enjoy the flick. The Cable Guy walks away. Steven walks back inside.
Who was that?
Nobody. Steven sits down next to Robin. Robin moves next to him.

A scene from the film "Sleepless in Seattle." The camera pulls out and reveals the Cable Guy watching t We cannot see much of the inside of the van because the o can tell that he lives there. (SCENE 29 OMITTED)
The Cable Guy and Steven walk across a parking lot. Steve
Sorry about yesterday. I was in kind of a weird mood. How'd things go with you? Keep 'em closed.
Pretty well. We'll see. Look, about the other night. I didn't appreciate you --
Don't peek. I want this to be a surprise.
I really don't need to be surprised. Where are we going?
Only the best restaurant in town. They walk around a corner.
Okay, here we are. Open sesame. Steven opens his eyes. The camera moves behind then and reveals an enormous faux says "MEDIEVAL TIMES RESTAURANT."
Medieval Times?
I know what you're thinking. Don't worry, I'm buying.
The Cable Guy and Steven are walking to their table. All arena, the kind a rodeo is held in. The entire restaurant decor. All of the staff are dressed as knights, sorcerers (Revision Ends - Pink)
Funny. I never thought I would ever come here.
I love this place. I come here twice a week. A Hispanic woman with a large butt walks by. The Cable Gu
Oh man, that's my look. I love big butts. Ow, that hurts. He grabs his crotch and squeezes, as if it's the only way
There oughta be a law. Man she is hot. It's just not fair.
(gestures to him squeezing his crotch) Please don't.
You know what I need right now? Pooooon tang. And I'm not talking about the place in Vietnam.
Good to know. They sit down. The WAITRESS walks over. She is dressed in enthusiastic about her job.
(flatly) Welcome to Medieval Times. My name is Melinda. I'll be your serving wench. May I get you something from the bar keep?
(too into it) Dost thou have a mug of ale for me and me mate? He has been pitched in battle for a fortnight an has a King's thirst for the beer thust thou might have for thust.
(uninspired) I'll be right back my lord. The Cable Guy puts something together.
There you go. He hands Steven a paper crown. They both put theirs on.
Thanks for the help. The Cable Guy sees something. His eyes widen.
Steven, don't turn around, but there is a woman eyeing you like you are a piece of meat and she hasn't eaten in a week. Steven acts like he isn't interested, but he is.
Really? What does she look like?
Shoe's a hottie. I wish she was checking me out. Man -- she is on fire! Total robo-babe.
Are you serious?
